messages.subject: after life/after lives
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/13/03 3:24:00 PM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/13/03 3:24:00 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< These days, people with beliefs like yours aren't even considered real
Christians by the people we're talking about. >>

Exactly.
I feel the same as Pam G. about a lot of things, that's why I don't openly
identify myself as Christian.
Unity is a "new thought" church which includes metaphysical teachings. That's
where I go.
It's considered a "theological cult" by mainstream christians and has been
labeled "dangerous."
The term christian implies so much more than what my beliefs encompass.
I don't belief Jesus is God, I don't believe in the Trinity, I don't believe
Jesus is the only way to a peaceful afterlife etc....
So I don't think of myself as very Christian.
I prefer "follower of Christ"
Christian implies too much that I don't want to be associated with.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
